Seems like when I try out a mom & pops place I have to compare corn beef anything with NY quality! Let me tell you this has to be the best and I mean best corn beef sandwich I have had in the valley!  The toasted bread was so fluffy and fresh that you can tell by the texture and flavors of the bread that it was not process nonsense. I was very pleased and so were my work buddies with the meals they chose. We will be coming back from breakfast very soon!

A bunch of folks I know really like this place.  Only being open M-F it is not someplace I could normally get to.  Last week I had a free day on my vacation and drove over. Glad I did!  The place was hopping about 11 with the early lunch crowd.  It was clear most of the customers were regulars as they were being addressed by name.  I had the grilled cheese on sourdough and a cup of cream of broccoli soup. At first I thought there was something wrong with the soup until I realized it was not loaded with salt and the main taste was the broccoli, what a concept! It is really a nice friendly place with great food.

So I have been hearing about Morning Star Café for a while now and since I was in the area I decided to give them a try. I was already prewarned to call my order ahead, which I did,  I have to be honest I really didn't look at a menu, I just asked my besty what her favorite thing was and that's what I tried. 

What did I try you asked?? Well I ordered the Green Chile Chicken sandwich and it was delsih!  It had chunks of chicken breast, diced green chilies and melted mozzarella cheese, this sandwich was amazing!!! Loved it, the flavors of everything was so fresh, it reminded me of homemade green chili for burritos, but instead severed on a sandwich, which worked, I would have never thought of doing that, but that's because in my house we use tortillas more than bread .

I also grabbed a brownie/cookie because it looked too good to pass up, and man was I glad I did! Deliciously sweet! 

Glad I gave Morning Star a try, I do have to admit I did past the place up when 1st looking for it, didn't know it was in a industrial area, but now that I have found it I will be back more often, and calling in my order ahead worked out perfectly for me too!

We are on a family vacation, flying into Phoenix from Atlanta, and driving to California.  On our way out of town, our 11 year old son randomly found this place online from all the great reviews, so we decided to give it a chance. Driving into the area, we thought we were taking a wrong turn, but there it was! We were doubtful, but can I tell you it was amazing! Not only are the owners just lovely, we had the best breakfast we think we've ever had. From the Rueben, the omelettes, the fresh baked bread, the bacon....everything was absolutely delicious. I would highly recommend anyone to visit this sweet place. We would love to come back again!
Family owned business very accomadating for our large party of 6. Large portions of home cooked breakfast. Will stip there agsin if im ever in Phoenix.
Stopped in here for breakfast after a flight in from Indiana. The food was great and the service was even better. If you're looking for home cooking this is your place.

Myself and my roommate come for breakfast as often as possible. It's a very "homey" family owned spot with simple, consistently great food. I've never had a bad meal here, most of the time I call ahead and pick it up to go in the mornings and they are really good at handling those, always give you an accurate time, rarely more than ten minutes. The food - the breakfast highlight is the Monte cristo, but try it for lunch too! It's amazing with egg dipped bread, crispy on the outside and melted ham and cheese on the inside with generous slices of thick cut bacon. Comes with homemade jam to really make it just out of this world. Sweet and salty mmmmmmmm. The Rueben will be one of the best you've had in Arizona. And although it seems crazy, they have a tuna melt that makes me think about it randomly. It's just a simple tuna melt but the way they make the tuna is perfect every time, fresh and consistent. This couple does such a great job, and they do everything the right way. They don't mind letting you get creative and making your own things up either! Thanks for being so great to us these last years.

Perfect little cafe! Great atmosphere, friendly staff.
Small mom & pop place. Come on in!

BACK FOR OUR WEEKLY LUNCH HERE. 
again  knocked it out of the park!!
always the best food!
the Ruben is out standing
thank you again for being the best in town!

Wonderful place to stop.  Stayed at the DoubleTree and walked down.  Their coffee is local and delicious.  The bread fresh and soft.  The couple running it very kind and inviting.  Very pleased with discovering this local shop.

The bread, coffee and omelette was delicious here! The owners were very sweet people, and the atmosphere is like a nice country kitchen. The prices are good- my latte was 3.05 and it was great coffee. I'll definitely come back here again, probably with a book to read. Its a cute cafe nestled in an industrial park.

Love this place, extremely friendly owners. Consistently great food and cleanliness. Would absolutely recommend the grilled egg sandwich, as well as the vanilla latte. Double if you need the extra boost!

This place is a genuine cafe, not some fancy restaurant or chain that uses "cafe" to sound unique.

Seems family owned and operated, they allow call-ins for orders ahead of time.  Offer daily specials.  Sure, entrees/meals are $6-8/each but the serving sizes are very large and could easily be split into two meals.  

eaten here twice, both times tasted home-cooked.  will eat here again.

Liked the Thursday and Tuesday special. (I recommend the PATTY MELT or Turkey Rellano sandwiches so far.

Note: They close at 3pm, and are in a uncommon location which to me just shows they are hard-working people that don't want to waste money paying for an expensive location when their food/character speaks for itself.
I am a fan.  Bread is fresh baked.  Breakfast sandwich rocked my socks off.  Small place in industrial area.  Well worth a visit.

Great place to eat in a quite tranquil ambiance... Food is good and all are super friendly!!! I was doing some work here before visiting a customer, had breakfast and worked out! Highly recommended!!!!
Tasty food and great service. The owners seem to really care about their customers. I'd definitely recommend stopping in for breakfast or lunch, or even breakfast for lunch!

Wow. What a great little find. I had a breakfast staple, 2 eggs with bacon and sourdough toast. 
The eggs were cooked to perfection. The sourdough toast was thick sliced and crunchy. The bacon was a thick sliced applewood smoked version, delicious.  Coffee was hot and good. They only do counter service. Very nice and courteous.  They cater to a interesting mix of people.  The restaurant is located in an industrial park next to a Safeway distribution Wharehouse. No signage to speak of. I arrived at 0900 and was joined by a pair of travelers and some utility workers. You know it's gotta be good because if not this little breakfast house would not exist. Don't blink when you go by or you will miss it!  Very good home style breakfast food and good prices. Run by a mom n pop. 
Enjoy!!!!
Stopped by on our way out of AZ and found this quaint little place.  Good food and friendly service.  I recommended you stop by and give it a try for a good breakfast and or lunch.

Interesting place nestled in a commercial area off alameda. You can definitely tell this is a family run business where the owners have put a lot of love and care into their business. Love the fact that they shared a lot of family photos of their grandson. The place isn't too big so I could see how it could get packed quickly on the weekends. The food is cheap and good! Definitely check this place out!

I stopped in here for Lunch today and met my girl Andrea K.

It's a cute little Christian themed cafe with an extremely friendly staff.

They offer breakfast all day, sandwiches and soups.

At first I wasn't in the mood for a "sandwich" and just settled for a turkey, I asked what came on it and was told "Anything, we customize them however you like" 
SO I was a bit perturbed when I asked for cucumber and avocado and they didn't have any......I ended up with turkey, sprouts, tomato, swiss and deli mustard on wheat (see pics)

 It actually was a really good sandwich but for almost $9 including a drink, I think it was a bit much.

Why 4 stars? 
~Service went along way, staff was personable and seemed to really care about the customers and I enjoyed the sandwich even though it was pricey.
This place is great!  Well worth going a little bit out of the way. The owners are very friendly and really care about their customers. The food is delicious and portions are huge!!!!
Outstanding customer service. Bathroom on back available and clean. Unfortunately, aside from the jam food was unimpressive.
Awesome family owned and operated local cafe. We enjoyed chatting with the owners and the food was great.

I've ordered from morning star several times and let me tell you, I've been more than satisfied each time. The portions are great and the service is very warming. I definitely recommend the Rueben sandwich, I have had many Rueben's and the sandwich here is by far the best, I highly recommend it. Check this place out for an early breakfast or late lunch during the week!

I've been here for breakfast and lunch. Had the monte cristo for breakfast... It's huge!  Strawberry jam compliments the sandwich nicely! Ordered the turkey rellano for lunch.. All I can say is wow!!!! So delicious. Perfect combo of turkey, chillies, mayo and cheese. You have to try this sandwich!

Full disclosure, I came here mainly for the name in a tongue-in-cheek joke with myself. To me, Morning Star is an anonym of Lucifer (from the King James Bible) so, while I wasn't completely surprised it was highly Christian-themed inside with painted Bible quotes on the walls and "family" decorations, I wasn't sure why they'd choose to name their cafe that. I'm not Christian myself, so it must have a completely different connotation in other versions of The Book that I'm not aware of without consulting Wikipedia.
It was also in a very industrial area, tucked into the outside corner of a warehouse building - easy to miss driving past, between all the semi trucks, even when you're looking for it. They probably get a lot of work and trucker traffic - but with the decor theme and location, it was all a bit confusing.
The important bit, the food, was delicious. Very cheap and came out quick. My bacon and cheddar breakfast burrito and coffee were both better quality than I expected. My dad also enjoyed his chorizo and green chile burrito. The two people behind the counter, who I would assume were the owners in this mom-and-pop type place, were very personable and attentive. Overall, a nice breakfast, but I think I'll leave this one to the regulars. There are less  garishly decorated breakfast joints in the area to cater to us heathens.

What a delightful surprise!!  Easy to get to although you'd never think to look in this location for a restaurant. 

Excellent bacon. Eggs were cooked perfectly and the sourdough bread was delicious. Coffee was good too. We also ordered a sandwich to-go for our flight home. Say hi to owners from Duluth, MN.

As an avid traveler, I can count on 1 or 2 fingers (maybe) where I come back to the same spot and have the same thing the very next day. This little spot? FANTASTIC

Fresh everything, passionate husband and wife team ready to offer suggestions. 

Delicious, inexpensive. Really...for $5 I had a HUGE wrap with probably 3 eggs, chorizo (had the chorizo and chile---just enough spice) w/ a delicious salsa on the side. 

And why Starbucks when, for about $2.50, you get a locally roasted cappuccino. 

If I lived here, this would be my breakfast spot. An EASY 5 stars

The owner may claim to be simply 'politically incorrect' however that is a statement that I have heard from many a racist before. Its the same as saying, "I'm not a racist, I just believe in genetic purity." 

I was unhappy to be at the receiving end of a rant that wandered from how he threw his wife's food out because she'd put salt on it. Which apparently offended him as a chef...or something. In my opinion that is abusive, controlling, misogynist behavior that is reprehensible. It at least points to an inability to communicate and a sharp need to be correct, perhaps a dangerous need.

Furthermore, his referencing 'Lousy-anna' referring to Lousiana, the Shreveport area if I remember correct, became tiresome immediately. He called the population of the area he used to live, please forgive me, niggers! His claim that he was referencing the white and black population fell short when he told a story of catching a young black child he caught stealing. He apparently asked the child why he was stealing and was offended that the answer as that "You whites have been stealing from us for years."  I had to leave to get to work, I would have left just as quickly had I not had to be at work 5 minutes later. My only regret was that I had to leave my poor girlfriend there...

Sir, if you wish to be a racist (excuse me: Politically Incorrect) you can do it without my dollars lining your pocket. I am sad to no longer have a place on my way to work that I could stop to grab a bite. I am truly discomfited riding my bike past the cafe and seeing that you are still in business. 

If you like your breakfast with a side of racism and misogyny, eat here. If you are a Russell Pearce, Joe Arpaio, or SB1070 supporter, here is your place. 

If you feel that people should not be judged, eat somewhere else. Somewhere that doesn't just dress up in bible verse, perhaps somewhere that embraces christian values, not just trite statements everywhere you look.

First time in and it's all thanks to YELP reviewers. The friendly mom and pop shop has been here for 10 years. We tried the green chili chicken soup, which had a great spicy kick to it. I had a veggie omelette and asked for tomatoes and cheddar cheese added to it. Got to choose a side of white, wheat, or sourdough toast (usually not a big toast fan ill have maybe 1-2 slices) but this, I had 3 of 4 since the bread was just TOO good! The omelette tasted completely homemade- none of that fake eggs subway uses. The Cheese steak sandwich is also one to try! Friendly service, great big portions, fresh bread, and not bad prices, definitely need to go again!
Greeted with a smile and great service. Food was delicious and authentic. Got the Italian Sandwich and Soup of the day. Both solid choices, filling and fresh. Would definitely recommend to a friend!
Great place for breakfast or lunch. Friendly staff, great food. No preservatives. Homemade desserts. Muffins to die for. Consider splitting a sandwich with a friend so you can split a dessert.
Interesting location amongst warehouses. Cozy environment. Fabulous owner Peggy Marshall told us all about Phoenix and stuff to do. Highly recommend the chorizo wrap. Thanks MSC!

Good food, good service and the owners run the place.
Food came quickly, was tasty and fresh.
Owners took time to check on us.

Going back!!
Nice family-owned cafe with yummy veggie options. Super friendly owners made our visit special especially for our kids.

People are nice. Food is mediocre. Had the special, which was a Turkey wrap with cranberry salsa. Thought it would be a good/healthy spin on Turkey dinner.
The wrap was dry and the lettuce mix was bitter. Cranberry salsa was bitter as well. Not sweet like you would think when looking at cranberries.
Was just Turkey, salad mix, tortilla, and a small thing of cranberry salsa on the side
I love the small cafe vibe! They had quick service and delicious coffee! They can also pack it to go if you're in a hurry! I definitely recommend coming here for your morning coffee and breakfast!

Bread is tasty. Eggs and bacon are okay. Layout, seating, and ordering/paying are a little confusing for a first-timer.

If they added a prominently displayed sign at the front of the store, it'd be easier for first timers to figure out that the place is order at the counter, pay at the counter, and tip at the counter. Then, seat yourself and food is brought to you.

The food itself could be tastier but the portions are large.
Best cream of Mushroom soup. Ever. All the soups are homemade and everyday it's a different soup! Mmmm

Well deserved 4 1/2 star rating., I give it a 5. Truly a mom & pop business,, operated by a husband and wife. The service is excellent, my veggie omelet was loaded with veggies & cooked perfectly and reasonably priced. The regular coffee is great and they also have expresso, etc. The menu isn't fancy,  just  basic, simple breakfast & lunch fare.  I served 2 of their fresh baked pies for Thanksgiving and it was unanimous among 10 people that they were outstanding.

This place is off the beaten path in Tempe's  industrial area but well worth seeking out. Try it, you'll like it.

Yelp brought me to this place when I was looking for a locally owned breakfast joint.  It did not disappoint, and I have turned into a repeat customer every since.  The owners are always so friendly and willing to chat if it is slow.  

Favorites: Coffee is brewed slightly sweet and is a great price!  BLT tastes better than I could make at home, big plus that the bacon is amazing and cooked correctly!  

I will definitely return here many more times!

This place gets 5 stars in every area. Great food, great service, and great people. We came in and got a Denver omelet, a Spinach, Bacon, and Swiss omelet, and a BLT. All were really good, and the sourdough bread was awesome. I also got an iced coffee myself, and it was great. I'm actually craving it right now. To top it all off, the people who work here are very nice. The two people we talked to were husband and wife. The husband was super nice, joked around with us, and made sure we were happy with our food. The wife was also really cool. I'm glad we came here, and if we stop by Phoenix area again, we'll be here again.
Just ate theFrench toast and it was amazing!  Bty this is my first time here. I only came in because of the yelp reviews but I will be back again and again!
The food is really good! My whole family all ordered something different and we all loved what we had. I had the breakfast burrito which was absolutely delicious. I would definitely go back.

I would not return to this place unless you are looking for a sub-par breakfast establishment. I don't recommend it. Eggs were  supposed to be over medium but came out brown and cooked too hot. The white was brown and crispy, and the white was still runny. The coffee had no flavor whatsoever, and the salsa was so vinegary i had to stop eating.  Don't waste your time or money.

Morning Star Cafe is this cute little cafe in a business district area around the corner from the Angels Tempe Diablo Stadium. We took our 11U baseball team which totaled to a 24 people (parents, players and siblings).  They were so welcoming and handled us perfectly.....One person (the owner) was serving all our food and refilling our coffee and he did an outstanding job. The also make latte's and cappuccino's and my husband has the best nutmeg cinnamon vanilla latte. The food was amazing. The BREAD is baked fresh and is delivered to the cafe every morning from a local bakery.  You can really tell that everything is made fresh. I had the spinach, bacon and swiss omelette and it was so flavorful, not greasy and DELICISOUS.  Their pancakes and omelette portions are big enough to share. The owner's were a very sweet couple and they and their staff were incredible.  Thank You so much from the T2 Orioles 11U Baseball Team, Corona CA

This is a hidden gem. Tucked away in a truck driver Industrial Park, this mom and pop breakfast spot is definitely top notch. The Monte Cristo and Pancakes are excellent. You can definitely taste the freshness in their "from scratch" recipes on down to the jumbo muffins and baked goods. The homemade muffins remind me of my mom's... Super yummy!
First time I tried this place today. The food was so good and the staff is amazing. I will definitely be returning!!!

Morning Star Cafe is a small family owned restaurant with 10 to 12 tables for sitting. I enjoyed the Italian Zucchini & Tomato dish, a simple omelette with a bit of Romani cheese. The zucchini, tomato, and romano cheese made the perfect combination of flavours which my mouth really loved. Served with sour dough toast with butter, complete deliciousness.
I was not allowed to take pictures of everything, why I only give them 4 stars.
Excellent food and friendly, personal service. The Monte Cristo is great. It's off Priest and Alameda in an industrial area. Non de script and non pretentious. Perfect.

Their bread is baked fresh daily!! YUM! Their sandwiches are huge, so I'm glad they serve halves. The tuna melt on Rye (with Swiss substitued for cheddar) is amazing and delicious! Very small place, but definitely worth it. They are super friendly too!
food is delish! they have really good specials and the service is great! quiet quaint place that is a little diamond in the rough!
Amazing breakfast!! The omelet was delicious and it was the best bacon I have ever had! The coffee was better then Starbucks!! I would come back and I would recommend it to friends!

I can't even begin to explain how much I love this place! Such a cute café and the food was amazing. Its nestled in between industrial buildings and doesn't look like much from the outside but I was complete blown away by the customer service and food. 

Peter and Peggy both greeted me and talked me through the menu. I ended up getting the half tuna melt and onion soup. I don't say this often but it was the best lunch I have had in a very long time, you could taste the love it was made with, I can't wait to try the breakfast! Also! Don't forget to grab a cookie...they are a MUST!!!

The first thing you need to know is that this is a "place your order and sit down" cafe. Second thing to know is that everyone is very friendly here and wants to make sure you enjoy your food. I had the 2 egg breakfast with bacon and wheat toast. Everything was cooked perfectly and tasted great! The only strange thing was plastic silverware, but it worked just fine and not a big deal. I wasn't a fan of the coffee, but my wife really enjoyed it and her breakfast as well. 

I would definitely recommend this place as a casual "off the beaten path" cafe.

MUST GO!!  Ok, where do I start.  Today was our first visit to the Morning Star Cafe but it won't be our last!  The quality, freshness, and flavor of the ingredients makes this restaurant get it's 5 star rating!  The homemade cheese danishes are the best ones we've ever had!  

We each had a variation on eggs and bacon for our breakfast.  My husband had a 2 egg breakfast, I had an egg, cheese and bacon breakfast sandwich, and my sister-in-law had an egg and cheese wrap.  The eggs were cooked perfectly in all 3 variations.  The sourdough bread was delicous.  The roll on the breakfast sandwich ......  YUM.  My sister-in-law was raving about the salsa that came with her breakfast wrap.  

We are very excited to go back and try their lunch menu now.  (although I'm going to be craving those cheese danishes for a while!!).  Mouthwatering!!!

The last two things worth mentioning are the exceptional service and warm atmosphere.  The husband and wife owners both talked to us and made us feel so welcome.  We're new to the area and they gave us some great information.  It was like we were talking to friends we'd known for a while!  It really made the meal special.

Thank you, Morning Star Cafe for doing what you do, the way you do it!!  
See you for lunch VERY soon!

I decided to try this place out because my new job is nearby and the reviews were all positive. I will say you have to keep your eyes peeled because I accidentally drove right past it.

I walked in and it's a nice little restaurant with maybe 10 tables at most. I asked the owner what he recommended being that it was my first time there- he was super nice and went through the rundown. I ended up having the special which was Roast Beef and a HUGE iced coffee. The sandwich was amazing- I ate the whole thing in one sitting. 

If you're looking for a good sandwich and want to try something new try this place - it will not be a let down!
Great coffee, food, and atmosphere. The owners are very friendly. Highly recommend the muffins and 3 egg breakfast..

This was a wonderful find! My boyfriend and I came here around brunch time and loved it! We have never been before but were immediately welcomed and given some great recommendations. To start we had coffee and tea (great selection of hot teas) and a homemade triple berry muffin with blueberry, raspberry, and blackberry. I had the Tuesday  daily special of turkey relleno sandwich and he had the one egg breakfast with sourdough toast. We even got a broken molasses cookie on the house which was lightly sweet and chewy.
Very friendly and welcoming with decor that made you feel homey, like you were in someone's kitchen not a restaurant. They had a really cute patio area too! We're from out of town but we will return when we are back in the city and I'm telling all of my local friends.
It's little and tucked away without a big sign so be careful not to miss it!

Peggy and Peter offer the most warm morning smiles. The food is incredible!! Breakfast wraps and omelettes are so so Tasty.  Awesome restaurant and the hospitality is truly wonderful! Recommend to anyone looking for the BEST breakfast!!

Everyone should check this place out. Shopping local is one thing but its so hard to find a good mom and pop place in the city now a days and this place is just that and it won't let you down. The food is awesome the couple who owns it and run it are so nice and acomidating . they will chat with you and make you feel at home. Maybe one of my favorite lunch spots in town.
Great service, owners make you feel like family. Good coffee, great food (get the monte Cristo!!) and great company. Can't go wrong.

Hidden Gem. Visiting from out of town and I felt right at home.  Friendly fast counter Service,  if it isn't too busy, take a moment to chat with the owners - they're delightful. I had the 2 egg breakfast with bacon, wheat toast, and strawberry Jam.  The bread and jam were homemade, the bacon was thick cut crispy, cooked to perfection and nothing was greasy in the slightest.  It was plenty of food and I couldn't quite finish it all.  I did steal a bite or two of my husbands pancakes-- thick, fluffy, and golden...who could resist?  The smooth coffee was the perfect compliment to a great meal. The only complaint would be a somewhat limited menu (no hash browns) Not enough of a complaint to detract from 5 stars!
Went for late breakfast...ended up with an early lunch....food was fantastic...had the reuben...on the best I've ever had
Great food stop with lovely hosts! Breakfast sandwich is incredible. Pancakes were a hit with kids. We are really glad that Yelp suggested this spot to our family.

Awesome breakfast!! The best I have had in a while probably! and the waiter and waitress's were awesome, friendly and very nice!! My boyfriend had the monte sandwich and I had the French toast and another time the omelet, they were both delicious.

I ordered chicken salad stuffed tomato. It was so, so. My husband ordered a "Monte Cristo" that said it had egg which was weird but he thought he would try it. It came out a Ham and swiss with turkey on slightly toasted sourdough. It was NOT a "Monte Cristo"! He thought about complaining but it took so long to get in the first place he just kept it. Never returning.

Wow, really glad we found this place on Yelp. Food was outstanding, service was quick, servings were large, and prices were fair. I had the oh-so yummy Green-Chile Chicken sandwich and my wife had a top-notch Monte Cristo -- topped off with a shared strawberry dessert. We'll be back and we'll bring friends

This spot is the perfect lunch spot when your craving old school soup, and sandwich cafe. The food is always good, fast, filling, and they've some great daily specials. The Couple that own the place are friendly and provide great service. This place has a country vibe and is in an industrial complex - meaning the place isn't super fancy , but food quality and value are top notch.

The MorningStar Café was a great experience, you normally wouldn't expect such great food, service and extremely warm and loving environment from a place that is sort of hidden but it is truly a gem. The owner was be on hospitable and sweet and it was an amazing experience all the way around.
Get the Monte Cristo! Fresh and good quality. Friendly owners that will have a conversation with you. Good coffee too!

Completely unimpressed. My girlfriend and I did not feel the least bit welcomed. I guess they feel customer service isn't necessary since the business is family owned? Food was mediocre. We were kind of afraid to eat it. We got pancakes, eggs and bacon. Pancakes were decent but my friend discovered old food stuck to the bottom of her plate while trying to enjoy. The man who served us looked dirty and like he didn't feel like serving. My friend accidentally spilled syrup on one of the menus and when he came to pick it up, we watched him take it to the back and show the lady working the register with a scowl on his face, looked like he mouthed something distasteful. The whole thing looked unprofessional and we were very uncomfortable. We ended up leaving with pretty much full plates. We weren't full yet..  Just didn't feel right.
I have no idea where to start. Ordered the Monte Cristo and I was blow the fuck away. The bacon is so crispy. The bread it has that toasty to perfection taste. The staff was awesome. Love this place!
Oh my god. So good. Perfect hole in wall place . The was amazing and the service was great. Anytime we are gonna be around here we are coming back
This place is a hidden gem.   From its baked goods to their filling sandwiches you cant go wrong.
Good food, but they are not fast at delivering it. They do take their time. The Ruben is good, it is grilled. Southwest chicken is also tasty.

Great little Christian owned cafe.
My eggs were cooked just the way I like. That's a first for any restraunt.
Wife omelette was huge
We will defiantly come back any time we are in the area 
God Bless

A couple of years ago I was looking for a lunch spot. Who knew this little gem was right outside the confines of our campus?  The Turkey sandwich special on Tuesdays?  Soooooooo gooooood. The first time I only ate half and saved the rest for later in the day. Now I'll stuff the entire sandwich into my face and moan for a couple hours because I ate way too much in one sitting. The cakes and pies are delicious too. I try not to let my inner fatty eat here everyday. :)  The management and staff are very nice and pleasant to speak to while you wait for the delicious creations.

This is a small family owned cafe super cute and welcoming. I ordered the chicken sandwich with green Chile. The food was great and the service was even better. Definitely recommend this place if your grabbing some lunch.

What a great lil gem tucked away in an industrial area. We love to find little "mom and pop" places like this! Super friendly owners, cute little API for a quick, but healthy lunch! The honey wheat bread is so awesome! Highly suggest to give them a try!
What an amazing little joint to have an AWESOME breakfast! Fair prices and the owners were super!
Had the Turkey sandwich with green chile.  Really friendly family and the sandwich was excellent!  Great family place to stop!!
Such a cute little place with great breakfast and coffee.   Stop in if you are in the area and want a quick , home cooked type breakfast or lunch.
Great breakfast place. The food is outstanding and the owners are warm and friendly. Loved it!
Just what you want for breakfast Home baking especially the brownies. Loved the sausage provolone wrap

I like the place.. Not a big fan of ordering at the counter due to the fact that there are no a lot of tables and I would not want to order and have no place to sit, but with a small crowd it seems to work .. 

The food was very good except they did not serve chopped potatoes with breakfast.  We spoke about it and they did not want to serve any type of frozen potatoes.. I still think they could chop up fresh potatoes cook them to a point where they need a few min to finish and serve..  

All in all I would come back .

Strange little place... Bible quotes painted on the walls, pictures of Jesus hanging, and religious music playing. You'll definitely get your dose of scripture if you can find this tiny spot tucked in the middle of a very industrial area. I was traveling for business, needing to escape my hotel, and limited on time - so didn't have many options.

I didn't like... that my table was dirty (as were a couple others) in a nearly empty restaurant. As I sat, the place filled up a bit: prompting the owner/ employee sitting next to me to get up from his breakfast and help out (but not wash his hands first). Also... No fruit/ potato/ grit side options.

I did like... that my food came out quickly, the wrap I ordered was big and tasty. The coffee was hot and strong. 

It's also an independently owned, little mom and pop shop. I dig that.
Yummy monte cristo! We also tried a blueberry, raspberry, blackberry muffin which was to die for. Quick, inexpensive, and delicious breakfast. Will be back soon.

Excellent monte cristo. And Peter, the owner, greeted me, rang up my order, and while my sandwich cooked he chatted with me at the counter like an old buddy. He told me how all his food is fresh daily and local. And his cook has been with him for 9 years. 

Quaint little place with great food and great mom-and-pop service.
Awesome mom and pop cafe!! We got the french toast and eggs and they were delicious! Reasonably priced too! The owners were super nice. I highly recommend it!

A very lovely small family-styled breakfast/lunch place. Very friendly service, by the couple who owns the business. Serving is quick, and most importantly, delicious! Had veggie omelet; oh my, so good that I literally fell in love with the home-made taste!
This place is precisely what you want when you're trying to do brunch.  Beyond satisfactory

I found this cafe on my Yelp app and I am so glad I did.  I had an egg sandwich - it was the best I had ever had.  I also had a slice of cake that was divine!  The owners were super sweet.  I will be back!

If you're gonna plaster Christ all over your establishment and basically name your place after him.....don't be a jerk. 


Long story short, came in to pick up an order.....their card reader wasn't swiping my card and one of the (male) owners was a jerk about it. He reluctantly entered it in manually, which I guess was a big enough deal to be unkind and unprofessional about.

Maybe don't take patronage for granted and perhaps actually try to embody the values you're supposedly projecting the image of through your business?

PS-
The stripe on my card works fine, it was the establishments card reader that wasn't working and the owner took it out on me.

I do not understand why this breakfast spot is so highly rated.  The owners seemed very nice and very religious which I guess is why they are rated so highly.  But, honestly, we are from out of state and wanted a nice breakfast spot.  This place is sandwiched in between what seem to be storage facilities.  This was such a miss.  They claim the coffee is the best around.  YUCH.

This is a tiny little place and it's great! I have been here a few times. Once, sat outside- they let us sit without ordering to talk to a friend (very kind of them). Second time, inside. Food is really good. I had a pancake (giant!), extremely affordable and the owner/managers were really nice and through with taking our coffee orders. My husband had the egg sandwich with ham. Total bill under $15. He's super picky and loved it. We will be back anytime we are in this part of town.

Good little spot in an interesting location.  Sort of a business park/industrial area and it's tucked away.  They seem to have a good local following. 

I had the half soup/sandwich but no coffee this time.  Based on other coffee review comments, I'm going to have to stop by for a cappucino.

Good prices, GREAT soup (chicken corn chowder).
Loved this little mom & pop. Good food, better service, tucked away in an industrial park. Chatted with the owners who were super nice. Open early and very affordable.

Really great little Breakfast/Lunch place tucked into one of the most industrial parts of Tempe.  You might not even know it was there were it not for a few covered tables on a make shift patio.  Really great food, super prices and almost disgustingly nice people who work there!  

The place is so cute.  Black and white checkered tiles.  White bead board up to a chair rail.  Very homey without being overly kitschy.  

While they do all the basics, and do them well, this isn't just your basic fare.  How about their Muffelatta for $5.15?  Or their Hot Sweet Italian sandwich - with sausage, onion, peppers and mushrooms w/ melted provolone cheese ($5.85)?  And their Spinach salad with egg and bacon for $5.05?  All good.  They even have a Monte Cristo ($5.15) on their menu! And their basics are great.  I had the Tuna melt ($5.05) on an employee's recommendation and it's one of the best one's I've had in a long time.  I haven't had their breakfasts yet, but I've got my eye on their Egg, Chorizo and roasted green chile wrap for $3.25.  

And then there are their drinks.  Sure - when I saw I could get Hires Root Beer or Squirt with my lunch, I was stoked.  But then I saw their coffee menu.  How about a large (32oz) Iced Coffee for $2.25? Or a large Iced Chai for $2.05???  They also Cappuccino, Espresso and Lattes for similarly great prices.  

But in the end, it's the folks who work there that have knocked me out. My first time there, the girl who took my order remembered my name and checked on me twice at my table - by name.  She wasn't a waitress, just worked behind the counter.  But when she came to clear a table, she just wanted to check on things.  

I almost hate to give the place up, but the more folks who come by, the more likely I am to be able to keep this place around.  So I definitely encourage you to come by.  Even if it's to just grab a coffee and a baked good.  Yes - they bake things fresh on site every day.  Just one more layer of their oh so goodness.  If only they were open on Saturday...

Hours: M-F, 6am-3pm

It was a pleasure visiting with owner's Peter and Peggy this morning. Our breakfast was fantastic; made with jumbo eggs, large crispy butchered bacon, thick multi-grain "Texas" toast, on and on.  Farm to Table at it's finest. Cheap too!

Excellent food. Topped only by the service, which is the friendliest you'll find in Phoenix. 

I had the 1/2 sammie and soup. I chose their 3-cheese grilled cheese, which was great, along with their chicken tortilla soup. It cost me $3.10.

I had a huge (generous portion) of 2% milk for $1.75 and a cup of coffee, which I heard was some pretty great coffee. I liked it, yes, but I wouldn't rave that it was the best ever. 

My colleagues loved this place. They said they can't wait to come back. Good! 

I was able to talk to the owner about Yelp and how we all heard of this place. I'm glad I was able to do a lunch search in the area of Eba Cafe. This place is the perfect lunch spot, followed by a quick drive over for boba tea afterwards. 

They serve breakfast all day. The prices are reasonable. And, like I said, it's super friendly. So, what are you waiting for? Go!

This is our new sandwhich addiction. We ordered to go over the phone, so it was ready when we arrived. Turkey Club and Muffalatta. We shared half of each sandwhich with each other.  The Muffalatta reminded me of the one I had in New Orleans, and the bacon in the Turkey club was sensational. Tslk to them about tipoing before they ring you up.

what stands out for this cafe is the customer service. the owners are really hospitable and friendly. the cafe itself has a cozy feeling. it is located centralized and near an industrialized area. in terms of the food, it is made with care but felt that it lacks a bit of flavor.

Omelette was overcooked with sparse fillings and served with toast only, no potatoes. Eggs and bacon served with toast only, no potatoes. We had three people drinking coffee, two with cream. Counter attendant poured cream in one cup of coffee and brought the other cups to our table, black. We asked for cream. He took the cup of coffee back and poured some cream in...what??? No coffee refills and no cream option for our table, the entire time. Plastic silverware. Terrible experience. Not anything I'd ever repeat.

I was really craving a tuna melt, hadn't had one in a long time, and we found this place recommended for that. WOW, it was awesome!  It was by far the best tuna melt I've ever had.  Great little place that is off the beaten path in an industrial area, not easy to find, but well worth the trip. 
I can't stop thinking about how good that sandwich was!  It's like going to your grandma's house and having her make you a really really good sandwich using Texas toast style sourdough, buttery toasted, and fresh tuna salad. Nothing like anything I've had before at a restaurant!  Loved it that much!  We will go back soon for sure to try their breakfast and infamous coffee.
Best breakfast I've had in Phx all week and the owners are super nice as are the other patrons!! Will definitely be back next trip!  Oh and yeah, the coffee is pretty darn good!!!

Nice little place. Too bad they are only open for breakfast and lunch Monday - Friday. Based on what I had and the likely hood that I'll never be able to make it to this place for lunch, and since there simply is not much that can be done for breakfast by anyone to make it something special I can only give 3.5 stars. Giving them the benefit of the doubt, and since I can't actually give a half-star rating I give them 4 stars. Besides it is a mom/pop place and they are better than some national/international chain (rarely will ever give a chain better than 3 stars); I can't lump them into same category as the chains. To do so would be injustice.
